events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their car with another vehicle at an intersection. They filed the claim immediately after the incident on May 1st.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the nature of the reported vehicle collision.
An agent with expertise in vehicle accidents was assigned to the claim promptly to ensure proper handling and quick resolution.
The insurance provider officially acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and confirmed initial processing steps.
Additional documents such as the police report, driverâ€™s license copies, and photos of the damaged vehicle were requested to support the claim evaluation.
The customer submitted all requested documents within the timeframe, including detailed photos of the damaged car and an official police report.
The investigation team began assessing the vehicle damage claims, verifying the accident report and liability based on submitted evidence.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the accident was unavoidable and the customer was not at fault.
A settlement offer was proposed covering all repair costs for the damaged vehicle along with a rental car allowance during the repair period.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and praised the timely communication and support received.
The insurance claim was approved following customer acceptance of the settlement terms and confirmation of documentation completeness.
Payment was processed and issued to the customer for the repair costs and additional expenses covered under the auto insurance claim.
After payment processing and confirmation of vehicle repairs, the claim was officially closed with a positive outcome for the customer.
The full claim file and documentation were archived securely for future reference and compliance purposes.
